  • City: CINCINNATI

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was dropped and cap of 1 bottle came off and hazmat was placed in bin to prevent any further leakage. DescribePack: Cap of 1 bottle came off and leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed in bin to prevent any further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023080761
item.description:
Report X-2023080761

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon the unloading of the trailer, package was placed on conveyor were a trainer had noticed a small white solid leaking from a package on the trailer. Trainer stopped the conveyor and called a manager who then alerted QA to come and perform research regarding corrosive nature of the contents and perform cleanup procedures, DescribePack: no package failure DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: conveyor was stopped on notice of package leaking contents. Package was isolated and upon retrieving SDS, proper cleanup procedures were done

item.title: Report X-2023080726
item.description:
Report X-2023080726

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found 8-4 at 0300 in the unload area, carton was wet and was brought to QA for inspection DescribePack: one inner container had a loose lid which caused internal leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ppe was used to contain package in a plastic hazmat bag which was then placed in a sealed plastic tote

item.title: Report E-2023080889
item.description:
Report E-2023080889

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 16, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was punctured by a forklift and released its full contents to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed absorbents to the released material and worked them in using hand tools. The crew further deployed a degreasing agent and wiped the surfaces with absorbent pads. All UN3266-impacted material was containerized in two (2) 35-gallon drums for disposal.

BOX WAS TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A forklift puncture resulted in the damage of (11) bottles of Porc-A-Clean; a total release of (2) gallons of material onto the cardboard packaging and pallet. A contractor cleaned the release and disposed of the damaged product containers.

item.title: Report E-2023080513
item.description:
Report E-2023080513

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: MASSILLON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While out delivering freight driver observed a drum staged on their trailer slightly leaking. Further investigation revealed that a nail protruding from the pallet the drum was staged on had slightly punctured the bottom of the drum consequently contributing to the unintentional release. The drum was repaired with drum putty and the spilled material cleaned with absorbent materials.

item.title: Report E-2023080569
item.description:
Report E-2023080569

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 31, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was forked and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. ES personnel overpacked the one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum of Lubrizol (UN1993) in one (1) 85-gallon overpack that was planned to be sent back to the shipper by RLC personnel. ES personnel utilized absorbent wipes mixed with a degreasing solution to remove all Lubrizol (UN1993) from the concrete surfaces. All Lubrizol (UN1993)-impacted material was collected in one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal

item.description:
Report X-2023080036

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: PORTSMOUTH
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Norfolk Southern personnel found tank car NATX364254 leaking from the top of the car under movement. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was found from the manway as the result of a crushed and deteriorated manway gasket. The gasket was replaced and the car returned to transportation.

item.title: Report E-2023080539
item.description:
Report E-2023080539

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T00:32:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A metal tote containing residual mineral spirits released onto the trailer floor, onto the dock, and underneath the trailer. A total of (3) gallons released. There aren't any visible punctures on the tote. It was apparent the release came from the valve. A contractor cleaned the impacted areas with spill pads.
